title: GraphCheck: Breaking Long-Term Text Barriers with Extracted Knowledge Graph-Powered Fact-Checking
author: Yingjian Chen (University of Tokyo), Haoran Liu (Texas A&M University), Yinhong Liu (University of Cambridge), Rui Yang (Duke-NUS Medical School), Han Yuan (Duke-NUS Medical School), Yanran Fu (University of Tokyo), Pengyuan Zhou (Aarhus University), Qingyu Chen (Yale University), ..., James Caverlee (Texas A&M University)
relevance_why: The incorporation of knowledge graphs for enhancing fact-checking and entity relationship understanding can be applied to improve text interpretation in audio captioning tasks.
background: Fact-checking involves verifying the truthfulness of claims using textual evidence, especially within large documents where complex relations exist.
contribution: GraphCheck introduces a graph reasoning framework to enhance large language model performance in fact-checking tasks, achieving a 6.1% improvement over baseline models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional fact-checking methods struggle to verify complex relations and often require multiple model calls, resulting in inefficiency.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes graph neural networks to represent and process knowledge graphs to facilitate single-call, efficient verification.

key_innovation: Integrates structured knowledge via knowledge graphs to allow for multihop reasoning and more nuanced fact-checking capabilities.
real_world_impact: By enhancing factual accuracy, particularly in critical fields such as medicine, this approach can directly improve patient safety and decision-making processes.
limitations: The quality of the knowledge graphs directly affects performance, and no reliable methods for assessing their quality were discussed.

new_terms.Graph Neural Networks: **Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)** are a class of neural networks designed to work directly with the graph data structure, optimizing for node and edge feature interactions.
new_terms.Knowledge Graphs: **Knowledge Graphs** are structured representations of knowledge, capturing entities and their interrelations, facilitating improved reasoning tasks.

open_sourcing: The authors have provided an anonymous code repository for their proposed method.
